image.altText: Four seals resting close to each other on a rocky shore.

props.synopsis: Australia is surrounded by the deadly H5N1 strain of bird flu. And it is morphing as sea animals and birds bring it ever closer to these shores.

title.children: ‘Pandemic potential’ as deadly bird flu strain surrounds Australia

image.altText: A group of MPs with Prime Minister Anthony Albanese in foreground.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese's re-elected government includes a record number of female MPs, but insiders worry there is a long road ahead to promote women to top leadership roles.

title.children: PM's captain's pick throws doubt on when Labor will get next female leader

image.altText: Oscar Jenkins charged

props.synopsis: As the government intensifies its efforts to free Australian man Oscar Jenkins from a Russian jail, Anthony Albanese is expected to meet Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Rome.

title.children: Albanese to meet Zelenskyy amid moves to secure release of Jenkins

image.altText: A white naval vessel stationary in river water under the Brooklyn Bridge in the dark, with its mast snapped at a 90-degree angle

props.synopsis: Mexican navy ship, the Cuauhtémoc, has hit the Brooklyn Bridge in New York City during a promotional tour, causing significant damage to the top of the vessel's mast.

title.children: Navy ship crashes into New York's Brooklyn Bridge injuring 19

props.synopsis: One person is dead and at least five are injured after an explosion at a fertility clinic in Palm Springs, California.

title.children: California fertility clinic bombing an 'act of terrorism', FBI says

image.altText: Anne Ruston in the Senate.

props.synopsis: A split has emerged between some members of the Liberal and National parties over the future of the opposition's commitment to net-zero and nuclear.

title.children: Net zero and nuclear should not be in Coalition agreement, according to Ruston

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks at Ali France's campaign headquarters

props.synopsis: Does Labor have a mandate to do what it wants after its big election win? Do mandates even exist?

title.children: Does Labor have a mandate to do what it wants after its big election win?

image.altText: Woman with silver hair and wearing shirt and pullover standing arms crossed in front of EV

props.synopsis: Demand for household batteries in Australia is on the cusp of an explosion, and new data suggest most people are motivated by personal considerations.

title.children: Self-interest the main concern as households queue for subsidised battery boom

image.altText: JJ holding the Eurovision trophy while singing as confetti flutters down

props.synopsis: Austria has won the 2025 Eurovision Song Contest and will take home the translucent microphone-shaped trophy.

title.children: 'Dreams come true': Austria takes Eurovision crown with Israel in second

image.altText: A middleaged man in a blue shirt, which has the logo blurred, stands outside a family home on a grass strip.

props.synopsis: Multiple witnesses giving evidence at the coronial inquest into the April 2024 stabbing rampage have stressed the "benefit of hindsight" in revisiting their interactions with Joel Cauchi.

title.children: 'Did the best I could': Witnesses defend actions amid Bondi stabbing inquest

image.altText: A man in a blue collard shirt stands talking to people next to a brick wall

props.synopsis: Structurally the omens are not good for the Liberals, particularly outside Queensland.

title.children: Get ready for more wildness as the Coalition grapples with defeat

image.altText: Ezra Mam participates in NRL Broncos training, looking over his right shoulder

props.synopsis: Brisbane five-eighth Ezra Mam plays his first NRL match this year, coming into a Broncos team struggling for form. Follow live.

title.children: Origin teams finalised as Mam returns from lengthy suspension

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 4' Dragons player Dylan Egan clutching at his knee
Broncos and Dragons begin NRL Sunday
Luke Lewis and John Gibbs pick their NSW Blues team for State of Origin I

image.altText: Tristan Xerri and Toby Nankervis both reach for the ball while intertwined

props.synopsis: As Richmond and North Melbourne continue their rebirth and development, this Sunday arvo MCG clash gives each a chance to measure their respective rebuilds. Follow live.

title.children: Tigers and Roos compare rebuilds in intriguing MCG clash

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: We are underway at the MCG!

image.altText: A woman with long red-brown hair stands looking down seriously at sheets of paper on a kitchen island.

props.synopsis: Criticism of the ACT Revenue Office stamp duty concession scheme intensifies, including calls for reform within the legislative assembly, after Canberrans received notices they owed tens of thousands of dollars within a few weeks.

title.children: Steph separated from her ex years ago. Then she got a $35,000 bill

image.altText: Thumbnail prison escape

props.synopsis: Accused murderers are on the run after escaping prison with help from people on the inside, authorities say.

title.children: Prisoners leave message telling guards escape was 'too easy'

image.altText: Woman in blue tights and red jacket stands in front of fashion week sign.

props.synopsis: The popularity of thrifted and second-hand items has been on display at this year's Fashion Week. Experts say it's vital for the future of the industry.

title.children: Thrifted clothing booming at this year's Australian Fashion Week

image.altText: A generic image of a woman shutting down a smartphone

props.synopsis: Experts say switching off our phones and devices regularly can help preserve battery life and protect against cyber attacks.

title.children: Do you really need to switch your phone and laptop off regularly?

image.altText: Teacher points at ipad with three highschool students in class, smiling and looking at content online.

props.synopsis: The governor-general says misinformation is the scourge of our times — and Australia's future is at stake.

title.children: Schools to adopt media literacy course in wake of crushing civics results

image.altText: A toddler sitting behind a birthday cake.

props.synopsis: Lin Fu Zhen was a name that I constantly rejected as I thought it sounded different from other Indonesian names. Recently, I realised the negative feelings might have stemmed from how the ethnic Chinese minority in Indonesia were treated in the past.

title.children: I denied my Chinese heritage until I found my happy place

image.altText: A boy in a red shirt sits in front of a building razed to the ground

props.synopsis: Israeli forces ramp up a bombing campaign that has killed hundreds of people over 72 hours, amid ceasefire talks with Hamas.

title.children: Israel launches expanded offensive in Gaza amid ceasefire talks

image.altText: The Male Division, Oatlands Gaol, Tasmania

props.synopsis: Tiny cells unearthed below an old swimming pool in the Tasmanian town of Oatlands shine a light on the "miserable existence" endured by inmates who were once imprisoned at a colonial-era jail that stood on the site.

title.children: Prison cells unearthed below pool highlight Tasmania's convict past

image.altText: Conclave elects the new pope, at the Vatican

props.synopsis: The contrast of Pope Leo and Donald Trump goes far beyond Christendom or American economic power; it goes to what we want from our leaders, who we will follow, who we will heed, and where our future lies.

title.children: The pickle of 'woke' Pope Leo for MAGA Catholics

image.altText: South Australian One Nation state MP Sarah Game.

props.synopsis: South Australian One Nation MP Sarah Game says she is quitting the party and will serve out the remainder of her term as an independent, becoming the second SA upper house member to quit her party in the past week.

title.children: Sarah Game quits Pauline Hanson's One Nation to stand as independent

image.altText: A drawing of Sean Combs, wearing a pale blue jumper, making a heart sign with his hands while standing in court.

props.synopsis: Disgraced hip-hop mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs always knew how to attract attention but he probably never anticipated the circus that now surrounds him at his criminal trial.

title.children: Giggles, scuffles and trial by TikTok: The Diddy courtroom circus

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Each week, I optimistically roll out another Hard Quiz for your Sunday morning entertainment. Surely you can repay the favour by improving every now and then?

title.children: One of these days you might blitz Hard Quiz. I don't think today will be that day

image.altText: A black and silver Visa bank card seen placed on a blurred background of another turquoise bank card

props.synopsis: Visa and Mastercard want to give artificial intelligence bots more control of Australians' bank cards, in a technological advancement they say could "revolutionise" shopping.

title.children: How AI could soon be built into your bank card — and spend your money

image.altText: A man in white and a man in blue in front of a production line.

props.synopsis: Manufacturers in China race to fulfil US orders as the reciprocal tariff pause takes effect, but the renewed trade war has already caused some businesses to take drastic measures.

title.children: What Chinese factories and businesses think about the US tariff pause

image.altText: Nicolas Cage holds a surfboard and holds his face aggressively close to the face of Julian McMahon as a boy watches on.

props.synopsis: Filming in Yallingup, Western Australia, Nicolas Cage brings his classic freak-out energy to a claustrophobic thriller set primarily in a beachside car park.

title.children: Australia's toxic surfer culture on the big screen in new Nicolas Cage film

image.altText: A two-storey brick house is left exposed with its back wall torn off

props.synopsis: Storm systems sweeping across the US leave dozens of people dead, including 14 people killed after a tornado in south-eastern Kentucky.

title.children: Deadly tornado and severe storms sweep across US

image.altText: A man outside court.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne man wrongfully convicted of the notorious murders of two police officers — for which he last month secured a multi-million-dollar settlement — is now being sued over his role in an armed robbery.

title.children: Jason Roberts faces robbery lawsuit weeks after settling wrongful conviction

image.altText: Housby takes aim from the super shot arc as Aiken-George sticks her hand up ready for a rebound

props.synopsis: Now that Super Netball's two-point shot has also been added to top-flight leagues in England, New Zealand and South Africa, how likely is it to make its way into the international game?

title.children: Will the controversial super shot be introduced to international netball?

image.altText: A woman smiles. She wears medals around her neck and a bright yellow shirt that says "Elizabeth".

props.synopsis: In communist Poland, Elizabeth Szczepanska's athletic prowess helped feed her family. In the decades since arriving in Australia, it has helped forge a life.

title.children: Elizabeth has won 193 medals and there are two she won't part with

image.altText: Flavio Briatore leaning over the pit wall, through a gap in the fencing, before an F1 race

props.synopsis: In the wild, wonderful and unpredictable world of Formula 1 racing, Alpine stand alone as the undisputed leader in chaos.

title.children: The sacked Aussie, the Italian fugitive and an F1 giant's Hail Mary
